conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the suitcase when it is being pulled.
The suitcase can be pushed or pulled on the ground.
Identify the forces: Pulling Force, Weight, Normal Force, Frictional Force.
Weight (G) is calculated as 150 N downward.
Normal Force (N) balances the vertical component of the pulling force.
Frictional Force (f) opposes motion and is proportional to the normal force.
Resolve pulling force into vertical (F cos θ) and horizontal (F sin θ) components.
Net force in both directions must be zero for constant velocity.
In vertical direction: F cos θ + N - G = 0, so N = G - F cos θ.
In horizontal direction: F sin θ - f = 0, so F sin θ = μ (G - F cos θ).
Equation derived: F (sin θ + μ cos θ) = μ G.
Given minimum pulling force F = 90 N, solve for μ using sin 37° = 0.6.
Equation: 90 (sin θ + μ cos θ) = 150 μ.
